data.text: @begosh_josh @SteveHodgeNZ I consider it as focusing on regions with closely matching attributes to improve understanding.

@begosh_josh Because NSW and Vic had extensive previous outbreak and embedded spread of covid, whereas the states that openned up with limited covid then had outbreaks were a much closer match to the starting position of New Zealand.
@begosh_josh @Thoughtfulnz About 2/3rds of NT's population lives in 3 towns. That's a more concentrated population than NZ has.
@Thoughtfulnz @SteveHodgeNZ Highly selective AU data kind of invalidates any interpretive meaning. E.g NT has a population smaller than BOP - in an area of millions of sq km
@Thoughtfulnz Does it include VIC and NSW? Legend indicates not? If they are excluded- why?

@Thoughtfulnz Not sure this is a worthwhile comparison. Testing in Australia collapsed in about a week and has never recovered, so the “cases” numbers are a bit meaningless. 

The NPI aspect was also shredded in those Australian states, eg QLD CHO stating multiple times that he wanted spread.
@Thoughtfulnz Ah, right u are. That’s not good news. A quinella of immunity evading viruses. It’s gonna be a long winter.
@fabtknz @Thoughtfulnz Ah good. Can't be too careful when it comes to making sure folks know the positive spirit eh? 😀 agreed re split graphs btw
@Thoughtfulnz @SteveHodgeNZ Hopefully the MoH might start compiling that soon, given they are saying we should now focus on hospitalisation data rather than case numbers.
@serenity22 @SteveHodgeNZ After writing the immediate response, yes. There is just not that data in the public sphere.
